thread.title: Engineering student from Mumbai's Goregaon found hanging in Vasai jungle
thread.title_full: Engineering student from Mumbai's Goregaon found hanging in Vasai jungle - The Times of India

author: Sandhya Nair
title: Engineering student from Mumbai's Goregaon found hanging in Vasai jungle
text:
MUMBAI: A third year engineering student from Goregaon who had left home for college on Thursday was found hanging in the jungle of Vasai on Friday.
The Manickpur police said that Kapil Mishra (25) was found hanging from a tree. No suicide note was found on him. He was identified based on his Rizvi college identity card.
Kapil had left his Dindoshi home on Thursday at around 7.15 am. When he did not return by late evening, his parents searched for him. Calls to his cellphone did not get a response. His friends too were not aware about his whereabouts.
On Friday morning, the family registered a missing complaint with the Dindoshi police. Minutes later they got a call from Manickpur police regarding a body. The description matched that of Kapil.
The body has been taken for autopsy. Family members said that they did not have any relative in Vasai and were baffled why the boy came all the way to Vasai to commit suicide. They are suspecting foul play.
A one-way ticket to Safale was found on Kapil. Police said that Kapil may have decided to alight at Vasai and hanged himself at the isolated spot. Family members said that Kapil was unhappy as he was faring well in his studies.
But he did not show any signs of depression and was regular in college. His father an auto rickshaw driver had used his earnings to educate Kapil.
